flux

Flux computation.

class hydroroot.flux.Flux(g, Jv, psi_e, psi_base, invert_model=False, k=None, K=None, CONSTANT=1.0, cut_and_flow=False)[source]

Bases: object

Compute the water potential and fluxes at each vertex of the MTG.

run()[source]

Compute the water potential and fluxes of each segment

For each vertex of the root, compute :

  • the water potential (\(\psi_{\text{out}}\)) at the base;

  • the water potential (\(\psi_{\text{in}}\)) at the end;

  • the water flux (J) at the base;

  • the lateral water flux (j) entering the segment.

The vertex base is the side toward the basal direction, the vertex end is the one toward the root tip.

Algorithm

The algorithm has two stages:

  • First, on each segment, an equivalent conductance is computed in post_order (children before parent).

  • Finally, the water flux and potential are computed in pre order (parent then children).

Note

Here \(\psi\) are the hydrostatic water potential i.e. the hydrostatic pressure. There are no osmotic components.

hydroroot.flux.flux(g, Jv=0.1, psi_e=0.4, psi_base=0.101325, invert_model=False, k=None, K=None, CONSTANT=1.0, shunt=False, a=1.0, b=0.0, cut_and_flow=False)[source]

flux computes water potential and fluxes at each vertex of the MTG g.

Parameters

  • g – MTG

  • Jv – float (Default value = 0.1)

  • psi_e – hydric potential outside the roots (Default value = 0.4)

  • psi_base – hydric potential at the root base (Default value = 0.101325)

  • invert_model – when false (Default value = False)

  • k – dict (Default value = None)

  • K – dict (Default value = None)

  • shunt – bool (Default value = False)

  • a – relative factor to the main radial path conductivity (Default value = 1.)

  • b – relative factor to the shortcut path conductivity (Default value = 0.)

  • cut_and_flow – bool (Default value = False)

  • cut – and flow experiment

  • Example –

  • my_flux – flux

  • CONSTANT – (Default value = 1.)

hydroroot.flux.ramification_length_law(g, root=1, dl=0.0001)[source]

Returns the length of the ramified axes along the main axis.

X is the distance to tip along the main axis Y is the length of the ramification

Parameters

  • g –

  • root – (Default value = 1)

  • dl – (Default value = 1e-4)

hydroroot.flux.segments_at_length(g, l, root=1, dl=0.0001)[source]

Returns all the segments intercepted at a given length.

Parameters

  • g – MTG

  • l – length

  • root – (Default value = 1)

  • dl – (Default value = 1e-4)

Returns

  • number of segment
